pages.text:
.entry-header About Chef Jeanie Roland "Love is truly the foundation of cooking." Jeanie Roland was born in Waterbury, Connecticut and this is where her fascination of cooking began. She was obsessed with cooking at a very young age as she marveled at her mother preparing nightly meals for the family. Her love of cooking grew into her teens and later in life. A graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, Jeanie worked in California, Florida and travelled the world experiencing the amazing cuisines of China, Malaysia, Singapore, Hong Kong, France, Italy, Morocco, England & Ireland. In 2002, Jeanie, with her husband James, opened The Perfect Caper in Punta Gorda, Florida, The Perfect Caper has been a favorite of the gulf coast for nearly 20 years. In 2012, Jeanie opened Ella's Food & Drink, in Westerly, Rhode Island and has been a destination restaurant in Southern New England since its opening. With more than 30 years of experience in the kitchen, Jeanie Roland brings a culinary expertise and competitive energy to everything in both the back of the house as well as the front of the house. Located in Punta Gorda on Florida's gulf coast, halfway between Sarasota and Naples, on Florida's Gulf Coast, the Caper is a casually elegant neighborhood restaurant, with something for EVERYONE!

Chef Jeanie Roland and her husband/business manager James Roland own and operate The Perfect Caper restaurant and also Ella’s Fine Food and Drink in Westerly, Rhode Island.  The Perfect Caper is a 165-seat, display kitchen restaurant. (Ella’s is a 200-seat restaurant with private and terrace dining, featuring Chef Roland’s signature French-Asian inspired fare.)

Chef Roland has always extolled the virtues of the freshest ingredients in her kitchen, as well as the use of all natural and organic ingredients for her menu. Menus change frequently, not just as a challenge to herself, but also to the staff. As many diners love their menu Favorites, it makes it hard to change the entire menu. However Chef Roland, in her pursuit of perfection, has been quoted as saying that perhaps, "she has yet to create her best dish!" Chef Jeanie Roland Jeanie has been recognized by her peers for her achievements. With her restaurants The Perfect Caper in Punta Gorda, Florida, and Ella's Food & Drink in Westerly, Rhode Island, and more than 25 years of experience in the kitchen, Jeanie Roland brings a culinary expertise and competitive energy to everything she does. Roland uses refined French technique and Asian influences to create unique cuisine that keeps patrons coming back again and again. She's a seven-time James Beard Foundation nominee for "Best Chef: South," and nine-time Florida Trend Magazine "Golden Spoon Award" winner, lauded in Florida Trend Magazine's "Hall of Fame" 2016, 2017, 2018 & 2019. Chef Roland is the publisher of her first cookbook, Butter Love & Cream that was released in December 2018. Her cookbook is a user friendly guide to some of her favorite recipes over the past four decades of cooking professionally. Chef Roland has been featured on the Food Network programs, Beat Bobby Flay, where she did just that, and a competitor on Iron Chef Gauntlet, Season 2. She has more James Beard nominations than most chefs get in a lifetime and recently went toe-to-toe against Bobby Flay on Beat Bobby Flay (Food Network), where she won. Roland uses refined French technique and Asian influences to create unique cuisine that keeps patrons coming back over and over. She's a seven-time James Beard Foundation nominee for "Best Chef: South," and nine-time Florida Trend Magazine "Golden Spoon Award" winner, lauded in Florida Trend Magazine's "Hall of Fame" 2016 and 2017. Chef Roland has travelled extensively in China, Malaysia, Indonesia, Hong Kong, England, France, Ireland, Italy and Morocco, using those experiences to cultivate a globally and culturally inspired view of food. .entry-content .clear #post-## .entry-header About Chef Jeanie Roland "Love is truly the foundation of cooking."
